intro: Desfontainia spinosa var. hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's spinous desfontainia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
